Package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util

Class DirectMemoryUtils

java.lang.Object
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.DirectMemoryUtils
@Private @Evolving public class DirectMemoryUtils extends Object
Utilities for interacting with and monitoring DirectByteBuffer allocations.

    • destroyDirectByteBuffer

      public static void destroyDirectByteBuffer(ByteBuffer toBeDestroyed) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException, SecurityException, NoSuchMethodException
      DirectByteBuffers are garbage collected by using a phantom reference and a reference queue. Every once a while, the JVM checks the reference queue and cleans the DirectByteBuffers. However, as this doesn't happen immediately after discarding all references to a DirectByteBuffer, it's easy to OutOfMemoryError yourself using DirectByteBuffers. This function explicitly calls the Cleaner method of a DirectByteBuffer. The DirectByteBuffer that will be "cleaned". Utilizes reflection.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException
      IllegalAccessException
      InvocationTargetException
      SecurityException
      NoSuchMethodException
